result.execSummary:
The defendant Irvin L McGeshick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All costs to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in count #2 in Forest County case 15CM195.
Huber and good time - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).
Consecutive to: Jail sentence on court 1.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

Defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns.

Defendant may not have any contact with victim, Paul McGeshick.
Defendant must undergo anger management assesstment and follow thru with all recommendations.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Irvin L McGeshick

records.addlTxt: Defendant Irvin L McGeshick in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:32 PM. Burns - provides court with plea questionnaire - plead G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged, withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years on each count - concurrent to each other - with conditions of: court costs, employment/school, 200 hours of community service (total), no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, anger management and follow thru, AODA and follow thru, no contact with Paula McGeshick, State asking 90 days conditional jail on count #2 but Burns is free to argue. State and McGeshick aree. State - have complied with victim notification requirements and has provided the Court with a VIS.  McGeshick pleads G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - makes argument for 90 days conditional jail - otherwise follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - argues against jail time - follow joint recommendation. McGeshick makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1  - impose 90 days in FC jail - eligible for huber and good time - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - report no later than 8:30 AM on 1/22/16 - court will consider credit argument at a later time by counsel, costs (including DNA surcharge and domestic abuse surcharde) - paid thru probation on count #2; count #2 - 9 months in FC jail - stayed, place on probation for 2 years, consecutive to jail time on count #1 with conditions of: costs on each count (including DNA surcharge and domestic abuse surcharge) - paid thru probation, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service, AODA and follow thru, anger management assessment and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, no contact with Paula McGeshick, submit DNA sample - counsel objects, right to appeal, adjourned.

ADDRESS INFO for Irvin L McGeshick
Current: 11066 County Hwy M, 11066 County Hwy M, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 12-02-2015)
Prior: 11033 John K Rd, Crandon, WI 54520
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Paula McGeshick.

Defendant Irvin L McGeshick appears via video with attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:52 AM. Burns here for Bond hearing, asking for signature bond for stated reasons. State - does not object. Court - reduced bond to $1000 signature bond. No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Paula McGeshick.

Defendant Irvin L McGeshick in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Irvin L McGeshick in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:29 PM. Burns has complaint, informs Court that the defendant is currently sitting a sanction, has gone over the complaint with the defendant, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
No contact with victim. No consumption of alcohol.
